definitions.definition: used to refer to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
examples: a room with two beds in it

definitions.definition: referring to an animal or child of unspecified sex.
examples: she was holding the baby, cradling it and smiling into its face

definitions.definition: referring to a fact or situation previously mentioned, known, or happening.
used in the normal subject position in statements about time, distance, or weather.
used in the normal subject or object position when a more specific subject or object is given later in the sentence.
examples: it is impossible to assess the problem

definitions.definition: used to emphasize a following part of a sentence.
examples: it is the child who is the victim

definitions.definition: the situation or circumstances; things in general.
examples: no one can stay here—it's too dangerous now

definitions.definition: exactly what is needed or desired.
denoting a person or thing that is exceptionally fashionable, popular, or successful at a particular time.
(in children's games) the player who has to catch the others.
the study or use of systems (especially computers and telecommunications) for storing, retrieving, and sending information.
